column4: so i managed to run gparted on livecd using sudo, but all the menus and buttons are disabled, huh
how can i resize ntfs partition from ubuntu live cd?
yes
yes, how?
I think gparted can be run from the terminal if you boot from the live cd. plus the installer can split ntfs partitions
you can't modify partitions and drives that are mounted and being written too...things could get hairy
So how can i resize ntfs partition from ubuntu live cd?
so you're saying you've used gparted on the live cd and everything is inaccessible?
yes
and you booted from the live CD too to start it? I'm not sure why it wouldn't work then
true. I don't know why you wouldn't be able to modify things then, unless you had partitions from the drive mounted.
let's assume drive is mounted(i didnt do it on purpose though), how do i unmount it?
in the file manager, rightclick the partitions and choose unmount
done, harddrive unmounted, rerun gparted, still everything disabled
try rebooting again with the livecd...the livecd, afaik, should not be automounting partitions on bootup.
gparted shows status - no devices detected
make sure not to try to mount any partitions or access any files on the hard drive
turns out you can run gparted from system->administration->partition editor without any problems (all menus are disabled when launched from terminal even after reboot)
well i'm glad that worked for you...weird that it's locked out from the terminal though.
and partition editor found bad sectors on the drive :(
ouch
i guess that's why i coudnt resize it from live cd installer
either way thanks!
no problem
